Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: மனத்தது மாசாக மாண்டார் நீராடிமறைந்தொழுகு மாந்தர் பலர்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: There are many men of masked conduct, who perform their ablutions, and (make a show) of greatness, while their mind is defiled (with guilt).

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A person is shown performing a holy ritual of bathing in a sacred river ('நீராடி'). Their outward actions are of great purity and reverence.
Layered_Composition.Midground: They are hiding their true nature from the world ('மறைந்து ஒழுகும்').
Layered_Composition.Background: A symbolic, transparent view reveals the true state of their mind ('மனத்தது'). While their body is being cleansed by the holy water, their mind is shown as a swamp of black, filthy sludge—it is 'full of filth' ('மாசாக'). The external purity of the water cannot touch the internal corruption.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: There are many hypocrites in the world who perform outward acts of purity, like holy bathing, while their minds remain completely filthy and corrupt.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The central contrast is between the clean, sacred river water on the outside and the filthy, stagnant swamp-water of the mind on the inside. The act of bathing is a performance that has no effect on their true state.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The holy river is lit with a pure, sacred light. The swamp of the mind is a dark, ugly, stinking place. The image shows the absolute disconnect between the two.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A shot that shows the pious external action, with a surreal cross-section revealing the corrupt inner reality.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, with a strong contrast between the clean water and the filthy sludge.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Dualistic lighting to show the outer performance vs. the inner reality.
